relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
The many police departments on and surrounding campus keep it very safe.
Amazing students leaders are all in Greek Life. They are very big on campus and do a lot for the community.
Intrinsic Cafe is a great place to hang out. On Friday they have 2 for $5 bubble tea.
One of the cheapest colleges in the country and with a very high payback rate since all the careers are in technology.
Go to parties, participate in activities on campus, take the train to NYC.
The food is average but there are many options and GDS always tries to keep things new and exciting.
The ResLife office is great and those who live on campus really feel the sense of community within the residence halls.
The courses are challenging since they are mainly math and science based. There are many resources to help students succeed in these courses.

Joining Greek Life at NJIT is a great way to make many connections and give yourself experience. Don't be afraid to ask for help in a course when you need it, there are many places that offer free tutoring.
NJIT is a diverse and well-rounded school. The courses are challenging and rewarding. There are many clubs and activities which make it easy to get involved.
pageTitle: New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {176505=There are several Greek organizations on campus. The Greeks have a positive impact on the campus sponsoring safety events, raising awareness for causes and raising funds for them as well. There is a significant Greek presence on campus and a new housing facility for the Greeks will be opened fall 2013., 225328=I am currently a cadet in the Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps (AFROTC) on campus and will be attending pilot training upon completion of my bachelor' in May 2014. I have received beneficial leadership and management training that no college alone can teach., 257340=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 245381=Living on campus is ideal for time purposes, but dorm life can vary depending on the building you're in. Freshman dorms tend to have more events going on in them, while the Honors dorm tends to have a more social atmosphere. The upper class dorms tend to be somewhere in between. Honors dorm is by far the nicest (just built in 2013 I think and it looks like a hotel) while the others are pretty much the same. In these dorms, yeah you'll see cockroaches, smell weird smells, hear lots of dubstep, but whatever, it's all part of the college experience. If for some reason you decide not to live in one of NJIT's halls, there is a university apartment building right next to NJIT that I hear has reasonable prices.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Mr. Blank 01/03/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 4 people found this review useful. 4 of 65 Categories Comments Bang for the buck I find it to be a little pricey, especially for the dorm and food. Am enjoying being here It can be a depressing school, weekends are dead, very little parties, but the city is a train ride away. Campus is safe. Food is horrible. Am learning a lot As an architecture major it is very hard to get a good nights rest. Unlike other majors, archies live in their studios and can stay in their for many days. There is a lot of work but there is an equal amount of learning when it comes to this school. Login to rate or flag the reviews
